Frequency-Swept Stationary Spectra

While most EPR experiments sweep the magnetic field at fixed frequency, some setups (e.g., broadband spectrometers) sweep frequency at fixed field. The mars.spectra_manager.spectra_manager.StationaryFreqSpectra class supports this mode.

It mirrors mars.spectra_manager.spectra_manager.StationarySpectra but treats frequency as the independent variable. The resonance condition becomes:

\[\hbar \omega_{ij} = E_i(B_0) - E_j(B_0)\]

and the spectrum is computed as a function of \(\omega\).

Example

g = spin_model.Interaction((2.0, 2.1, 2.2))
zfs = spin_model.DEInteraction([10e9, 2e9])  # D=10 GHz
sys = spin_model.SpinSystem(electrons=[1.0], g_tensors=[g], electron_electron=[(0,0,zfs)])
sample = spin_model.MultiOrientedSample(sys)

freq_creator = spectra_manager.StationaryFreqSpectra(field=1.0, sample=sample)  # B = 1 T
freqs = torch.linspace(200e9, 400e9, 1000)  # 200–400 GHz
spec = freq_creator(sample, freqs)
